name: Browndorff's "Loreal," 75% German/Satin Doe, Chincilla, born 5/8/12
description:
Loreal is a gorgeous true "cold" color Chinchilla, with fiber that has a "checkered" black and white guard hair that creates a very unique halo in finished fiber work. Her sire, 100% German REW, Kodiak, had hidden color genetics that when paired with Browndorff's Pudding, a blue-eyed Chocolate, made a litter of 6 colored kits! Loreal has proven to carry on this rainbow palette in her breedings, and is a great mother to date, successfully rearing 6-8 per litter. Browndorff Rabbitry will be keeping her daughter, a Chin copy, in our barn for 2014 breedings, so we are able to re-home Loreal.

Born: 5/8/12
Sire: Windsor Farms "Kodiak", 100% German, REW. 
Dam: Browndorff Rabbitry's "Pudding", 50% German, Blue-Eyed Choice. 

For info on raising German Angoras, visit the IAGARB.com site and read articles written by US German Angora co-op raisers. Articles on other angora breeds do not necessarily contain accurate info on Germans. German Angoras must be sheared every 90 days, and produce up to 1 lb of fiber per shearing. 

I host classes on the art of German Angora Rabbit raising and wool use quarterly at Puffy Mondaes Sustainable Arts in Nampa, Idaho, and can help with any questions you may have. For a list of current classes, visit http://www.puffymondaes.com.

**At any given time we may have more stock for sale than is listed on our site. Contact us with your rabbitry needs and we will do our best to help.  On RARE occasions, transportation of German Angoras may be arranged, but it is safe to plan on picking your rabbit up in person in the Boise, Idaho area.

name: Browndorff's "Bernie", 87.5% REW Buck, born 3/13
description:
Bernie is a high-quality copy of his 100% REW German Sire, Madison, and hides the fawn, agouti, black, and REW color genes in his background. He'll be a great fiber rabbit for one, or a great breeder with the hope of colored hybrid kits when bred to a colored doe. All of Browndorff Rabbitry's hybrids have a non-matting, synchronous coats, and high wool production volume. 

Born: 3/23/13
Sire: Browndorff Rabbitry's Madison, 100% German, REW. 
Dam: Browndorff Rabbitry's "Falila", 75% German, Fawn. 

For info on raising German Angoras, visit the IAGARB.com site and read articles written by US German Angora co-op raisers. name: Browndorff's "Thomas", 93.5% German, REW
description:
Thomas takes after his mother, Alabaster, but hides a saturated black wool gene that is sure to appear if he's bred to a colored doe.  He's a great looking buck, and offspring to a pair that were chosen to carry on a darker black wool gene present in his Grand Dam, Browndorff's Asher. 

Born: 3/23/13
Sire: Raspberry Farms "Riley", 100% German, Black. 
Dam: Browndorff Rabbitry's "Alabaster", 87% German, REW. 

For info on raising German Angoras, visit the IAGARB.com site and read articles written by US German Angora co-op raisers.
